message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with discourse classification, which is a subfield of natural language processing. The use of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) also suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the use of multi-task learning and the synthesis of different tasks could place it in the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the use of different discourse annotation frameworks and the focus on classification could also suggest that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
